testcase.purpose: Check that loadedmetadata event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attribute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The user agent has just determined the duration and dimensions of the media resource and the text tracks are ready.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.networkState is NETWORK_EMPTY

spec.spec_statement: NETWORK_EMPTY (numeric value 0), The element has not yet been initialized. All attributes are in their initial states.

testcase.purpose: Check if audio.preload property exists

spec.spec_statement: The preload IDL attribute must reflect the content attribute of the same name, limited to only known values.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.src reflects the content attribute of the same name

spec.spec_statement: The src IDL attribute on media elements must reflect the content attribute of the same name.

testcase.purpose: Check that canplay event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attibute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The user agent can resume playback of the media data, but estimates that if playback were to be started now, the media resource could not be rendered at the current playback rate up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.

testcase.purpose: Check if audio.error property exists

spec.spec_statement: The error attribute, on getting, must return the MediaError object created for this last error, or null if there has not been an error.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.canPlayType method supported ogg format codecs parameter

spec.spec_statement: The canPlayType(type) method must return the empty string if type is a type that the user agent knows it cannot render or is the type 'application/octet-stream'; it must return 'probably' if the user agent is confident that the type represents a media resource that it can render if used in with this audio or video element; and it must return 'maybe' otherwise. Implementors are encouraged to return 'maybe' unless the type can be confidently established as being supported or not. Generally, a user agent should never return 'probably' for a type that allows the codecs parameter if that parameter is not present.

testcase.purpose: Check that playing event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attibute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: Playback is ready to start after having been paused or delayed due to lack of media data.

testcase.purpose: Check that progress event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attibute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The user agent is fetching media data.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.readyState is greater than or equal to HAVE_FUTURE_DATA if canplay event is triggered

spec.spec_statement: readyState newly increased to HAVE_FUTURE_DATA or greater.

testcase.purpose: Check that loadstart event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attribute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The user agent begins looking for media data, as part of the resource selection algorithm.

testcase.purpose: Check that play event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attribute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The element is no longer paused. Fired after the play() method has returned, or when the autoplay attribute has caused playback to begin.

testcase.purpose: Check that loadedata event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attribute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The user agent can render the media data at the current playback position for the first time.

testcase.purpose: Check if the audio.currentSrc property exists

spec.spec_statement: The currentSrc IDL attribute is initially the empty string. There are two ways to specify a media resource, the src attribute, or source elements. The attribute overrides the elements.

testcase.purpose: Check if the audio.readyState property exists

spec.spec_statement: Media elements have a ready state, which describes to what degree they are ready to be rendered at the current playback position.

Check that audio.preload reflects 'none' value

spec.spec_statement: The autoplay attribute can override the preload attribute (since if the media plays, it naturally has to buffer first, regardless of the hint given by the preload attribute). Including both is not an error, however.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.canPlayType method support marks-fantasmagorical-format

spec.spec_statement: The canPlayType(type) method must return the empty string if type is a type that the user agent knows it cannot render or is the type 'application/octet-stream'; it must return 'probably' if the user agent is confident that the type represents a media resource that it can render if used in with this audio or video element; and it must return 'maybe' otherwise. Implementors are encouraged to return 'maybe' unless the type can be confidently established as being supported or not. Generally, a user agent should never return 'probably' for a type that allows the codecs parameter if that parameter is not present.

spec.spec_statement: The preload IDL attribute must reflect the content attribute of the same name, limited to only known values.

spec.spec_statement: The src IDL attribute on media elements must reflect the content attribute of the same name.

testcase.purpose: Check that canplaythrough event is triggered if autoplay attribute present and src attribute give right address of the media resource

spec.spec_statement: The user agent estimates that if playback were to be started now, the media resource could be rendered at the current playback rate all the way to its end without having to stop for further buffering.

spec.spec_statement: readyState is newly equal to or greater than HAVE_FUTURE_DATA

spec.spec_statement: readyState newly increased to HAVE_CURRENT_DATA or greater for the first time.

spec.spec_statement: The canPlayType(type) method must return the empty string if type is a type that the user agent knows it cannot render or is the type 'application/octet-stream'; it must return 'probably' if the user agent is confident that the type represents a media resource that it can render if used in with this audio or video element; and it must return 'maybe' otherwise. Implementors are encouraged to return 'maybe' unless the type can be confidently established as being supported or not. spec.spec_statement: The canPlayType(type) method must return the empty string if type is a type that the user agent knows it cannot render or is the type 'application/octet-stream'; it must return 'probably' if the user agent is confident that the type represents a media resource that it can render if used in with this audio or video element; and it must return 'maybe' otherwise. spec.spec_statement: As media elements interact with the network, their current network activity is represented by the networkState attribute.

spec.spec_statement: The currentSrc IDL attribute is initially the empty string. There are two ways to specify a media resource, the src attribute, or source elements. The attribute overrides the elements.

testcase.purpose: Check that removing audio.src attribute tiggers loadstart event

spec.spec_statement: If a src attribute of a media element is set or changed, the user agent must invoke the media element's media element load algorithm. (Removing the src attribute does not do this, even if there are source elements present.)

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.currentSrc returns non-empty if add source element

spec.spec_statement: The currentSrc IDL attribute is initially the empty string. There are two ways to specify a media resource, the src attribute, or source elements. The attribute overrides the elements.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.canPlayType method supported mp4 format codecs parameter

spec.spec_statement: The canPlayType(type) method must return the empty string if type is a type that the user agent knows it cannot render or is the type 'application/octet-stream'; it must return 'probably' if the user agent is confident that the type represents a media resource that it can render if used in with this audio or video element; and it must return 'maybe' otherwise. Implementors are encouraged to return 'maybe' unless the type can be confidently established as being supported or not. Generally, a user agent should never return 'probably' for a type that allows the codecs parameter if that parameter is not present.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.readyState initial value is HAVE_NOTHING

spec.spec_statement: The ready state of a media element at any particular time is the greatest value describing the state of the element

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.canPlayType method support mp4 format

spec.spec_statement: A type that the user agent knows it cannot render is one that describes a resource that the user agent definitely does not support, for example because it doesn't recognize the container type, or it doesn't support the listed codecs.

testcase.purpose: Check that audio.canPlayType method support octet-stream

spec.spec_statement: The canPlayType(type) method must return the empty string if type is a type that the user agent knows it cannot render or is the type 'application/octet-stream'; it must return 'probably' if the user agent is confident that the type represents a media resource that it can render if used in with this audio or video element; and it must return 'maybe' otherwise. Implementors are encouraged to return 'maybe' unless the type can be confidently established as being supported or not. Generally, a user agent should never return 'probably' for a type that allows the codecs parameter if that parameter is not present.
